parameters: That’s what I tried to do.
But they said it was wrong.
I fought and fought and fought but got nowhere
I kept getting hurt and no one healed me.
So what are you doing that is so different?
They have friends like me to take on some of
Fighting and killing is wrong though.
Just because you’re hurting, doesn’t mean you
should inflict it on someone else.
You fought to resist your grief.
To try to ease the pain of loss.
But that’s not how it works.
Because the harder you fight, the longer it
You just keep winning, don’t you?
Why was that better than staying and fighting?
So you’re just a coward then?
You can’t face anything so you run away?
Do you not realize that leaving is the best
They stepped away from causing more harm.
They decide to be kind and not hurt another.
It may have been difficult to do but they made
a choice of compassion rather than pain.
And it’s hard to let go.
You have to know that since you’re here.
Knowing it’s gone can be the worst feeling
You take time to grieve it.

And then you move on the best you can.
